main_definition: To become unsteady or dizzy, usually as a result of spinning around quickly or seeing something very distressing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To experience vertigo or loss of balance
meanings_and_examples.example: After watching the fast-paced movie scene, she reeled on her chair.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A cylindrical spool on which thread is wound for use in sewing, filming etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: She carefully placed the fishing line onto a new reel before casting it into the water.
The children were laughing as they played on the merry-go-round, causing them to reel with excitement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A line of printed text that continues onto another page without a break.
meanings_and_examples.example: He noticed the new article began in the middle of a sentence and continued into the next column's reel.
